item.description:
So I've done a little bit of exploration here, and recently found part of the river trail.  I'd like to walk along the river trail tomorrow, and if we're adventurous (and they're mowed!) cut off into the fields and back through to the paved walk that will return us to our cars.  Portions of the river trail are narrow, with short but steep inclines periodically, some roots or loose gravel, but otherwise it's a very accessible trail.  My pace is about 2.5 miles an hour leisurely, but still what some would consider a fast jaunt.  I'd like to walk about 1.5 hours- enough to tire out my pooch for the evening.  I'd recommend pants due to the ticks and bug spray (mosquitoes were bad the last few times).  Friendly dogs welcomed (they required leashed- so i'll leave it to the owner's discretion and responsibility for their animals if you choose to unleash in areas like the open meadows, etc).  Please clean up after your dog (a side note- this park is open to horses, so we may have to step around some horse left-behinds on the trail, and also another reason they require leashes). 

Again- my disclaimer is that everyone is responsible for themselves- and that I don't know the trail network here very well, but am confident that if I were to get lost, it would be temporary (lots of main roads on all sides).  But you do need to be comfortable exploring with me if you're coming along.  Or if you know the park, please be comfortable suggesting routes as well!

This event will be cancelled due to lack of interest or inclement weather.  Please note there is a $1 fee collected to help Angela defray the Meetup fees she is charged.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the main lot as you come through the gate of Asbury, bear right twice

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Last minute Summer Solstice Walk! Exploring Bradley Palmer
